ReportSection.ReportItem: Select the ONE CFN research theme your research most closely aligns with: {$item}

ReportSection.name: Research Project
ReportSection.title: Section 2 - Information about Applicant's Research Project
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Keywords

Please provide up to a maximum of five (5) specific keywords or descriptive technical terms or methodologies that best describe the research â€“ e.g. Medline Headings. {$item}

Lay Summary

Provide a non-confidential summary in lay terms of your research project. Ongoing feedback from lay members of our committees, patients and their families and support systems, indicates the importance of succinct, plain language descriptions of research, particularly in mobilizing research findings. We are looking for a brief description of the research, why you are conducting the research and how it may impact health care for frail older Canadians. The summary should be written at a ninth-grade reading level (Flesch-Kinkaid scale). (Note: This summary will be evaluated by lay and scientific reviewers. For funded applicants, this summary may be used in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN website.) {$item}

Scientific Title of Research Project

{$item}

Scientific Summary

Provide a non-confidential scientific summary of your research project, highlighting the hypothesis, project objectives, milestones and deliverables, and potential socioeconomic impact. (Note: This summary will be evaluated by lay and scientific reviewers. For funded applicants, this summary may be used in media releases, communications and posted on the CFN website.) {$item}

Background and Research Question(s)

State the research question(s). Clearly articulate the context, population and intervention. Provide a review of the literature that identifies the knowledge gap or rationale for the research. Where applicable, clearly state the underlying hypothesis. {$item}

Methodological Approach

Describe the methodological research approach, including study design, data collection, analysis plan, etc. {$item}

Project Relevance and Impact

Describe why you feel the work you plan to carry out is important. Specifically, describe the relevance of your proposal to CFN strategic priorities and the fellowship program goals. Identify how this project will improve the care of frail older adults and support their families and caregivers. {$item}

ReportItem.descriptions: I expect that this research will require an ethics review.|I do not expect that this research will require an ethics review.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Research Ethics

If your research project involves biohazards, humans, human embryonic stem cells or animals, and you are selected for funding from CFN, certification of approval by the host institution certification committee must be obtained by your supervisor before funds will be released. {$item}

Environmental Assessment

Does any phase or part of the research project
  1. take place outside an office or laboratory, or
  2. involve an undertaking as described in part 1 of Appendix B of the Natural Science and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC) Form 101?
 {$item} If you answered yes to this question, and you are selected for the fellowship program, your supervisor will be required to complete an Environmental Assessment Impact Statement and the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act Pre-Screening Checklist for review and approval by CFN before funds will be released

ReportSection.name: Interest and Benefit
ReportSection.title: Section 3 - Interest and Benefit
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Expression of Interest

Please outline your interest in the CFN Interdisciplinary Fellowship Program. Describe how your academic, research, professional and/or practical skills, and your life experience will lead to your personal success in the fellowship program. {$item}

Benefit from Fellowship Participation

Describe how you believe you will benefit from each of the IFP Learning Themes (Frailty Assessment, Citizen Engagement, Interdisciplinary Collaboration, and Self-Directed Professional Development) and related activities outlined in the Program Guidelines. {$item}

Value Brought to Fellowship

Describe how your participation will benefit the fellowship program, the value you will bring to this fellowship cohort, and specifically how your participation will enhance an online collaborative project. {$item}

Career Aspirations

Describe your career plan and how a CFN Fellowship will help you achieve your career goals. {$item}

ReportSection.name: Partnership Funding
ReportSection.title: Section 4 - Partnership Funding

ReportItem.labels: Partner Organization|Potential Conflict of Interest|$ Amount of cash contribution|Type of Contribution

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please read the Program Guidelines and Application Instructions carefully before completing this section.

Identify all partners that have agreed to provide matching funds in cash for the fellowship award (50% cash from CFN; 50% cash from Applicantâ€™s partner(s)). Partnership funds must be from NCE-eligible partner. Please consult your Supervisorâ€™s host institution for details on NCE-eligible partners.

If you have other partnership cash contributions over and above the minimum required by the fellowship program, please include these in your application. You can also include eligible in-kind contributions from eligible sources that are contributing to your research associated with your fellowship.

For each partner {$item}

ReportItem.types: Text|Integer|Select(---,Cash,In-Kind)|Textarea|Select(---,planning to apply for,in process of being applied for,about to be submitted,submitted,pending,other)

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please identify all other sources of support that relate to the fellow during the entire period covered by the Fellowship (i.e. September 2017 to August 2018 inclusive). Include fellowship or scholarship revenues, and research or other grants â€“ no matter what the amount or status. Please read the Program Guidelines and Application Instructions carefully before completing this section.

For each funding source {$item}

Do you want to be considered for any CFN corporate-sponsored fellowships that may be open during the competition? (See Program Guidelines)

{$item}

ReportSection.name: CV and Experience
ReportSection.title: Section 5 - Curriculum Vitae and Experience

ReportItem.labels: Name of institution|Academic degree granted(or courses taken toward)

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Transcripts

Official transcripts must be provided for all post-secondary and clinical/medical school studies to-date. These original transcripts should be provided in a sealed envelope directly from the issuing institution. Please list the institutions from which we will receive your transcripts.

For each institution {$item}

Curriculum Vitae

Please attach a PDF of the full Canadian Common CV (CCCV) in Academic CV format.

{$item}

List any current/past professional employment and volunteer experience relevant to the fellowship.

{$item}

List any specialized training, conference attendance, collaborations, etc. relevant to fellowship (and outside of academic experience).

{$item}

List selected publications and presentations that are most relevant to fellowship.

{$item}

List any distinctions or other relevant information not captured in the CCCV format or in the sections above.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Learning Plan
ReportSection.title: Section 6 - Learning Plan
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please read the Program Guidelines and Application Instructions carefully before completing this section and discussing with your Supervisor.

The Learning Plan should be developed with your Supervisor and must be specifically approved online by your Supervisor. Progress reporting during the Fellowship by your supervisor will include this Learning Plan. List your desired learning outcomes and the activities you will undertake to achieve each outcome.

For each learning outcome {$item}

List any other outcomes that you believe you feel are needed for your professional development but that you feel you may not be able to obtain from the fellowship program. Please consult the Application Instructions for more details before you complete this section.

For each desired learning outcome {$item}

ReportSection.name: Capacity Disclosure
ReportSection.title: Section 7 - Applicant and Supervisor Capacity Disclosure

ReportItem.labels: Activity|Participant|Type of Commitment|Expected Time Commitment (hours per month)|Duration (months)

ReportSection.ReportItem:
The CFN Interdisciplinary Fellowship Program is designed to be rigorous and challenging. It requires ongoing dedication, and a regular and substantial time commitment. Applicants should expect to spend 10 to 12 hours per week over a 12-month period to complete fellowship activities.

A corresponding commitment of approximately 2 to 3 hours per week is appropriate for a supervisor. Applicants and Supervisors must list all known and anticipated activities in each category that are expected over the course of the Fellowship (September 2017 to August 2018).

For each activity {$item}
